column3: Marlatt provides an introduction to leaf leaf/s and the poems, explaining that they were written at a point when she was "trying to figure out who [she] was" and "trying to figure out language."
The 1969 recording of Marlatt reading leaf leaf/s is played.
Marlatt reads her poems aloud from where the 1969 recording left off.
The 1969 recording of Marlatt reading leaf leaf/s is played.
Marlatt provides some background on the inspirations behind the poem played aloud through the recording.
Marlatt decides between reading one or two more poems from leaf leaf/s.
The 1969 recording of Marlatt reading leaf leaf/s is played.

Marlatt points out that "you never know, when you're preparing for a reading, you feel like reading one poem and then when you get up there, you feel like reading another." People in the audience laugh.
Marlatt introduces the second part of leaf leaf/s.
The 1969 recording of Marlatt reading leaf leaf/s is played.
Marlatt prefaces the next and final poem that she will read aloud.
Marlatt reads the last poem for the event out loud.
